page.title: 05LINDEAN RESERVOIR
page.content: This reservoir supplie water to the surounding area including the villages of Midlem St Boswells and Lindean, however it is no longer used for water. It is principally used for fisshing as it is stocked with trout. Fishing permits are available from the Selkirk and District Angling Association. The Western half of the reservoir is a wildlife conservation area with reed beds and excellent cover for ducks and other waterfowl. There is a stone cairn at the eastern end of the Reservoir detailing the interesting features that can be seen and also the the seasonal interest that is present in the Reservoir
